sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A message sent from the Lords of His Majesties most honourable Privie Counsaile, now resident with His Majesty, directed to the citizens of London. Wherein is contained divers remarkable and considerable grounds and motives perswading to peace, which is the desire of all good men. England and Wales. Privy Council.
[2], 5, [1] p.
Printed by Leonard Lichfield, Oxford [i.e.London] : 1642.
False imprint: possibly a reprint of an Oxford original. cf. Madan. Annotation on Thomason copy: "Decemb: 13". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
A message sent from the Lords of His Majesties most honourable Privie Counsaile, now resident with His Majesty, directed to the citizens of London. Wherein is contained divers remarkable and considerable grounds and motives perswading to peace, which is the desire of all good men. England and Wales. Privy Council.
[2], 5, [1] p.
Printed by Leonard Lichfield, Oxford [i.e.London] : 1642.
False imprint: possibly a reprint of an Oxford original. cf. Madan. Annotation on Thomason copy: "Decemb: 13". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
Leonard Lichfield
>>>>>>> imprintparse
